It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery fronds that are often covered in a thin layer of moisture-retaining scales. This plant thrives in cool, humid environments, typically found in shaded, mossy areas of tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are located on the underside of its leaves and produce spores for propagation. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Trichomanes rarum is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
